item.title: Difference between font formats
item.description: Lorem ipsum dolor amet tousled viral art party blue bottle single-origin coffee cardigan, selvage man braid helvetica. Banh mi taxidermy meditation microdosing. Selvage cornhole YOLO, small batch vexillologist raclette VHS prism sustainable 8-bit ugh semiotics letterpress disrupt pop-up. Celiac shabby chic ugh, jianbing whatever kitsch tattooed edison bulb kogi irony etsy. Franzen polaroid hammock iceland blue bottle woke disrupt tilde kale chips raw denim ramps vaporware before they sold out irony.

item.title: First post
item.description: Instead I’ll want to make a layout section.html (with several partials, most likely) to display automatically. It’s not elegant, but probably the easiest way to do it is to make a layouts>section-name folder and put a section.html inside. To make links work: always works: ../{category folder}/slug works if in same folder: slug You might want to read this article on fonts. Or check out the second post

item.title: Second post
item.description: Post-ironic franzen brunch mumblecore readymade. Food truck photo booth polaroid, gochujang vegan street art yr before they sold out man bun. Tilde selfies chia pitchfork everyday carry post-ironic mumblecore sartorial VHS master cleanse activated charcoal biodiesel williamsburg cronut jean shorts. Poutine helvetica keffiyeh butcher pop-up. Go to home Go to firstpost Go to firstpost another way Check out this discussion of fonts

item.title: Sidenotes revisited
item.description: An ordinary, totally normal paragraph. No strings attached, no promises attached. Just dull content. Trust me. Another totally normal paragraph, but this time, it’s accompanied by a side note, sometimes also called boxout. This works well with CSS grid with the exception of side notes that take up more height than their related paragraph. Gotta try to avoid that. Another ordinary, totally normal paragraph. No strings attached, no promises attached. Just dull content.
